intro: Erechtites argutus var. typicus, commonly known as the roughleaf goldenweed, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes and stream banks. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
